#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Green Party candidate Lloyd
#Text=Helferty , Thornhill
#Text=Sunday , October 7 , 2007
#Text=Lloyd Helferty is running for the Green Party of Ontario in the Ontario provincial election , in the Thornhill riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=I ran for the Green Party initially for one reason : Peak Oil .
#Text=It was and still is an issue that is tremendously serious but is not given enough attention .
#Text=I believe it will in fact be the issue of this century .

#Text=But I have learned since then that there are many other serious related issues , such as climate change , that need to be tackled in an inventive way using an approach that relies on ingenuity and takes in a different perspective to the problem ~ and approach that looks at the entire system and its relationships to other problems rather than looking at each problem as if it were isolated .
#Text=We also need to look at problems using long-range thinking and not simply concentrating on the quick-fixes .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=I have run twice before in the Federal elections of 2004 and 2006 in Thornhill .

#Text=I am also on the board of directors of the Richmond Hill Naturalists , which gives me insight into local issues from the perspective of those working and studying natural systems ( ecosystems ) and their health and am a member of the Markham Conservation Committee as well , which gives me insight into programs that are being undertaken locally by the town .
#Text=I also have a longstanding relationship with some of the local community groups and understand some of the Regional issues affecting the quality of life of Thornhill residents .
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ? Why ?
#Text=I believe that my candidacy stands alone .

#Text=In fact , I see my biggest “ competitor ” as the independent candidate , whom I believe will likely be taking a portion of votes that would have probably otherwise come to me [ the so-called “ protest ” votes cast by voters who are fed up with main-steam politics and will vote for anyone except the big parties ] .

#Text=Of course , these are likely only a small number of people , and because I do have some name recognition in this riding , however small , I believe that people who are fed up with mainstream politics will still continue to gravitate toward the Green Party .
